bug.author: yaroslavvb
bug.description:
I'm seeing this error on wandb.init <denchmark-code>(main) √∑19-06-28 09:14:41|ttys010|trippings-mbp-3|~/git0/mindscribe-question-ai\√∑ python Python 3.6.8 |Anaconda, Inc.| (default, Dec 29 2018, 19:04:46) [GCC 4.2.1 Compatible Clang 4.0.1 (tags/RELEASE_401/final)] on darwin Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import wandb >>> wandb.init(project='moonscrub') wandb: Started W&B process version 0.8.3 with PID 33316 wandb: Local directory: wandb/run-20190628_161454-0ti1q1zb wandb: Syncing run easy-lion-3: https://app.wandb.ai/yaroslavvb/moonscrub/runs/0ti1q1zb wandb: Run `wandb off` to turn off syncing. Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/internal_cli.py", line 105, in <module> main() File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/internal_cli.py", line 97, in main headless(args) File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/internal_cli.py", line 53, in headless util.sentry_reraise(e) File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/util.py", line 88, in sentry_reraise six.reraise(type(exc), exc, sys.exc_info()[2]) File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/six.py", line 693, in reraise raise value File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/internal_cli.py", line 51, in headless user_process_pid, stdout_master_fd, stderr_master_fd) File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/run_manager.py", line 1053, in wrap_existing_process io_wrap.SIGWINCH_HANDLER.add_fd(stdout_read_fd) File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/io_wrap.py", line 118, in add_fd self._set_win_sizes() File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/io_wrap.py", line 138, in _set_win_sizes win_size = struct.pack("HHHH", rows, cols, xpix, ypix) struct.error: ushort format requires 0 <= number <= (32767 *2 +1) </denchmark-code>
Here are offending values <denchmark-code>> /Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/io_wrap.py(139)_set_win_sizes() -> win_size = struct.pack("HHHH", rows, cols, xpix, ypix) (Pdb) p rows 36 (Pdb) p cols 80 (Pdb) p xpix -15360 (Pdb) p ypix 1542 </denchmark-code>
This seems to be backend problem, I haven't upgraded any packages recently

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.85. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Is this on Mac OS? Is this in the stock terminal app?

This is on Mac Emacs, used through shell mode <denchmark-link:https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/manual/html_node/emacs/Shell-Mode.html>https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/manual/html_node/emacs/Shell-Mode.html</denchmark-link>
I'm also filing this bug from Emacs (jk)

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yaroslav>@yaroslav</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/pull/408>#408</denchmark-link> should fix the issue. If you can try installing this branch and confirming that would be helpful. We‚Äôll cut a new release this week.
Hard to reproduce, but from <denchmark-link:http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/ioctl_tty.2.html>http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/ioctl_tty.2.html</denchmark-link> this seems like correct fix

Seeing this again The relevant values <denchmark-code>(Pdb) p fcntl.ioctl(sys.stdout.fileno(), termios.TIOCGWINSZ, '\0' * 8) b'%\x00P\x00\x00\xc4\x06\x06' (Pdb) p array.array('h', win_size) array('h', [37, 80, -15360, 1542]) </denchmark-code>
Maybe the code should just check for exception and fallback to default window size <denchmark-code> File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/run_manager.py", line 1053, in wrap_existing_process io_wrap.SIGWINCH_HANDLER.add_fd(stdout_read_fd) File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/io_wrap.py", line 118, in add_fd self._set_win_sizes() File "/Users/yaroslavvb/anaconda3/envs/main/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/io_wrap.py", line 140, in _set_win_sizes win_size = struct.pack("HHHH", rows, cols, xpix, ypix) struct.error: ushort format requires 0 <= number <= (32767 *2 +1) wandb: ERROR W&B process (PID 85223) did not respond wandb crash with W&B process failed to launch, see: wandb/debug.log </denchmark-code>
Looking at relevant values:

Hi Yaroslav, Are you sure you've upgraded your W&B package? That value unpacks and packs successfully for me with the new code: import struct win_size = b'%\x00P\x00\x00\xc4\x06\x06' struct.unpack('HHHH', win_size) (37, 80, 50176, 1542) struct.pack('HHHH', 37, 80, 50176, 1542) b'%\x00P\x00\x00\xc4\x06\x06' The values look strange/impossible but there at least isn't an exception.
Yeah, weird. We'll catch the error in the next release. Do you have a sense for what the best default values would be?

I don‚Äôt think it will throw an error the way it is right now. If I‚Äôm missing something, I think it would be good to understand what is going on rather than handling an exception that we don‚Äôt understand.
There are a couple of default values in there already: 25x80, the ‚Äústandard‚Äù terminal size. <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Tue, Aug 13, 2019 at 6:37 PM Chris Van Pelt ***@***.***> wrote: Yeah, weird. We'll catch the error in the next release. Do you have a sense for what the best default values would be?
‚Äî You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#401?email_source=notifications&email_token=AAAQJPZUZMXZSVHBD6NRKMTQENOVDA5CNFSM4H4GX332YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOD4HOGOQ#issuecomment-521069370>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAAQJP4B467M6LRK3G3IOHLQENOVDANCNFSM4H4GX33Q> .
sorry for noise, that was indeed issue with old version of wandb the new version unapcks it to following values (37, 80, 50176, 1542)
